alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Eastern San Miguel County; Espanola Valley; Santa Fe Metro Area; South Central Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 10:46AM MST until January 05 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Central Highlands, South Central Mountains, Espanola Valley, Santa Fe Metro Area, Upper Rio Grande Valley, and Eastern San Miguel County. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes portions of Interstate 40 near Clines Corners and Interstate 25 through Santa Fe. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Eastern San Miguel County; Espanola Valley; Santa Fe Metro Area; South Central Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley
